summary: If you're anything like me, you abuse console commands to make yourself more powerful. Let me help you with that!
descriptionHtml:
[center][color=#b4a7d6][size=6][u][b]CRAFTING APPAREL FOR CHEATING BASTARDS[/b][/u][/size][/color]


[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/65163-1-1430165136.png[/img]
[size=5]
If you're anything like me, you prefer the certain look of a weapon or piece of armor over how strong it is. Sometimes, you can't even improve it past "flawless." If you want [i]everything[/i] you craft to be LEGENDARY, then [i]this mod is for you![/i][/size][/center]

[b][color=#cc0000][size=6]THIS MOD IS NOT YET AVAILABLE FOR THE SKYRIM SPECIAL EDITION!

THIS MOD WILL NEVER BE AVAILABLE FOR CONSOLES![/size][/color][/b]

[size=5]Yes, my friends, I'm going back to my roots with another BAT mod that adds enchantments to stuff. This time around, I've added fortifying enchantments to three full outfits that match their corresponding crafting skill. The blacksmithing outfit has "Fortify Smithing," the Alchemy outfit has "Fortify Alechmy," and so on. I've re-purposed the "Fortify Enchanting" alchemy effect, applying it to clothing.[/size]

[size=5]The power of the enchantment is dependent on when you activate the BAT file. If you have a smithing skill of 25 when you activate the BAT, then the outfit provided will have a magnitude of 25%. This keeps some semblance of balance to the mod, but really, I made it for those of us who like to abuse the console commands.[/size]

[size=5]Got any questions? Read the [/size][size=6][b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/articles/50789/?]FAQ[/url][/b][/size][size=5]!
[/size]

[center][color=#b4a7d6][size=6][u][b]REQUIREMENTS[/b][/u][/size][/color][/center][size=4]
1. The latest Skyrim patch (Version 1.9.32.0.8)


[/size][center][color=#b4a7d6][size=6][u][b]INSTALLATION[/b][/u][/size][/color][/center]
[size=4]
Step 1: Download the archive
[/size][size=4]Step 2: Open the archive with 7zip
[/size][size=4]Step 3: Drag and drop the txt file into your Skyrim data folder
[/size][size=4]Step 4: Launch the game
[/size][size=4]Step 5: Once in game, press the "~" key to open the console
[/size][size=4]Step 6: Type "bat (filename)" and press enter

[/size][color=#e06666][size=4][b]DO NOT USE A MOD MANAGER OF ANY KIND TO INSTALL!


[/b][/size][/color][center][color=#b4a7d6][size=6][u][b]COMPATIBILITY[/b][/u][/size][/color][/center]
[size=4]Wait, compatibility information for a BAT file? Yes!

There will be minor incompatibilities with the professional clothes module of [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/74541/?]Enchanted Vanilla Clothing[/url], because they essentially do the same exact thing. Go for that mod if you want something more balanced.



[/size][color=#b4a7d6][size=5][u]CHANGELOG[/u][/size][/color]

[color=#e06666]6/5/2016[/color] - [color=#93c47d]V 2.0.2[/color] - Corrected several more typos found in the code; initial release

[color=#e06666]6/5/2016[/color] - [color=#93c47d]V 2.0.1[/color] - Corrected several typos found in the code; never released

[color=#e06666]6/5/2016[/color] - [color=#93c47d]V 2.0[/color] - New and improved, more streamlined; never released

[color=#e06666]4/6/2015[/color] - [color=#93c47d]V 1.0[/color] - First itineration of this mod; never released and lost in the bowels of my hard drive, never to be seen again
